blocks.name: ccatc
blocks.content: Extend class notation to include the category Cat.

blocks.name: df-catc
blocks.content: Definition of the category Cat, which consists of all categories in the universe ` u ` (i.e. " ` u ` -small categories", see definition 3.44. of [Adamek] p. 39), with functors as the morphisms. Definition 3.47 of [Adamek] p. 40. We do not introduce a specific definition for " ` u ` -large categories", which can be expressed as ` ( Cat \ u ) ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Jan-2017.)

blocks.content: Value of the category of categories (in a universe). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Jan-2017.)

thm catcval(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí c0 = { <(Base ` ndx), c1 >, <(Hom ` ndx), c2 >, <(comp ` ndx), c3 > })
  ‚ä£ c0 =(CatCat ` c4)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c4 ‚àà c5)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c1 =(c4 ‚ãÇ Cat))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c2 =(s0 ‚àà c1, s1 ‚àà c1 ‚Ü¶(s0[Func]s1)))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c3 =(s2 ‚àà(c1 √ó c1), s3 ‚àà c1 ‚Ü¶(s4 ‚àà((2nd ` s2)[Func]s3), s5 ‚àà(Func ` s2)‚Ü¶(s4[o.func]s5))))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)

  ‚ä£ d(s1, w0)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, w0)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, w0)
} = {
  syl5eq(c0, { <(Base ` ndx), c1 >, <(Hom ` ndx), c2 >, <(comp ` ndx), c3 > }, (CatCat ` c4), w0)
  fvmptd2(hs0, ccatc, c4, { <(Base ` ndx), c1 >, <(Hom ` ndx), c2 >, <(comp ` ndx), c3 > }, universe, [(hs0 ‚ãÇ Cat)/ hs1]{ <(Base ` ndx), hs1 >, <(Hom ` ndx),(s0 ‚àà hs1, s1 ‚àà hs1 ‚Ü¶(s0[Func]s1))>, <(comp ` ndx),(s2 ‚àà(hs1 √ó hs1), s3 ‚àà hs1 ‚Ü¶(s4 ‚àà((2nd ` s2)[Func]s3), s5 ‚àà(Func ` s2)‚Ü¶(s4[o.func]s5)))> }, universe, w0)
  df-catc(hs0, hs1, s0, s1, s2, s3, s4, s5)
  csbied2(hs1, (hs0 ‚ãÇ Cat), { <(Base ` ndx), hs1 >, <(Hom ` ndx),(s0 ‚àà hs1, s1 ‚àà hs1 ‚Ü¶(s0[Func]s1))>, <(comp ` ndx),(s2 ‚àà(hs1 √ó hs1), s3 ‚àà hs1 ‚Ü¶(s4 ‚àà((2nd ` s2)[Func]s3), s5 ‚àà(Func ` s2)‚Ü¶(s4[o.func]s5)))> }, { <(Base ` ndx), c1 >, <(Hom ` ndx), c2 >, <(comp ` ndx), c3 > }, universe, c1, (w0 ‚àß hs0 = c4))
  a1i((w0 ‚àß hs0 = c4), (hs0 ‚ãÇ Cat)‚àà ùïå)
  inex1(hs0, ccat)

  simpr(w0, hs0 = c4)
  adantr(w0, hs0 = c4, c1 =(c4 ‚ãÇ Cat))
  tpeq123d(<(Base ` ndx), hs1 >, <(Hom ` ndx),(s0 ‚àà hs1, s1 ‚àà hs1 ‚Ü¶(s0[Func]s1))>, <(comp ` ndx),(s2 ‚àà(hs1 √ó hs1), s3 ‚àà hs1 ‚Ü¶(s4 ‚àà((2nd ` s2)[Func]s3), s5 ‚àà(Func ` s2)‚Ü¶(s4[o.func]s5)))>, <(Base ` ndx), c1 >, <(Hom ` ndx), c2 >, <(comp ` ndx), c3 >, ((w0 ‚àß hs0 = c4)‚àß hs1 = c1))
  opeq2d((Base ` ndx), hs1, c1, ((w0 ‚àß hs0 = c4)‚àß hs1 = c1))

  mpoeq123dv(s0, s1, hs1, hs1, (s0[Func]s1), c1, c1, (s0[Func]s1), ((w0 ‚àß hs0 = c4)‚àß hs1 = c1))
  eqidd((s0[Func]s1), ((w0 ‚àß hs0 = c4)‚àß hs1 = c1))

blocks.name: catcid
blocks.content: The identity arrow in the category of categories is the identity functor. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Jan-2017.)
blocks.origin:
thm catcid(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(cfv(c0, c1), c2))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(ccatc, c4))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cbs, c3))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(ccid, c3))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cidfu, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, c6))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c5))
} = {
  syl6eqr(cfv(c0, c1), c2, cfv(cidfu, c1), w0)
  fvmptd(hs0, c0, c1, cfv(cidfu, c1), c5, cfv(cidfu, cv(hs0)), universe, w0)
  syl5eq(c0, cmpt(hs0, c5, cfv(cidfu, cv(hs0))), cfv(ccid, c3), w0)
  simprd(w0, wceq(cfv(ccid, c3), cmpt(hs0, c5, cfv(cidfu, cv(hs0)))), wcel(c3, ccat))
  syl(w0, wa(wcel(c3, ccat), wceq(cfv(ccid, c3), cmpt(hs0, c5, cfv(cidfu, cv(hs0))))), wcel(c4, c6))
  catccatid(hs0, c4, c6, c3, c5)
  fveq2d(cidfu, cv(hs0), c1, wa(w0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1)))
  simpr(w0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1))
  fvexd(cidfu, c1, w0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cidfu, c1))
  diff.hs0.c(c5)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
  diff.hs0.c(c6)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm catcid(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí(c0 ` c1)= c2)
  ‚ä£ c3 =(CatCat ` c4)
  ‚ä£ c5 =(Base ` c3)
  ‚ä£ c0 =(Id ` c3)
  ‚ä£ c2 =(idFunc ` c1)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c4 ‚àà c6)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c1 ‚àà c5)
} = {
  syl6eqr((c0 ` c1), c2, (idFunc ` c1), w0)
  fvmptd(hs0, c0, c1, (idFunc ` c1), c5, (idFunc ` hs0), universe, w0)
  syl5eq(c0, (hs0 ‚àà c5 ‚Ü¶(idFunc ` hs0)), (Id ` c3), w0)

  syl(w0, (c3 ‚àà Cat ‚àß(Id ` c3)=(hs0 ‚àà c5 ‚Ü¶(idFunc ` hs0))), c4 ‚àà c6)
  catccatid(hs0, c4, c6, c3, c5)
  fveq2d(cidfu, hs0, c1, (w0 ‚àß hs0 = c1))
  simpr(w0, hs0 = c1)
  fvexd(cidfu, c1, w0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)

blocks.name: catccat
blocks.content: The category of categories is a category, see remark 3.48 in [Adamek] p. 40. (Clearly it cannot be an element of itself, hence it is " ` U ` -large".) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Jan-2017.)

blocks.name: resscatc
blocks.content: The restriction of the category of categories to a subset is the category of categories in the subset. Thus, the ` CatCat `` U ` categories for different ` U ` are full subcategories of each other. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Jan-2017.)

thm resscatc(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {

} = {
  jca(w0, (Homf `(c0[|`s]c1))=(Homf ` c2), (comf `(c0[|`s]c1))=(comf ` c2))

  mpbird(w0, (comf ` c2)=(comf `(c0[|`s]c1)), ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà(c1 ‚ãÇ Cat), ‚àÄ(hs1 ‚àà(c1 ‚ãÇ Cat), ‚àÄ(hs4 ‚àà(c1 ‚ãÇ Cat), ‚àÄ(hs3 ‚àà(hs0[(Hom ` c2)]hs1), ‚àÄ(hs2 ‚àà(hs1[(Hom ` c2)]hs4),(hs2[(< hs0, hs1 >[(comp ` c2)]hs4)]hs3)=(hs2[(< hs0, hs1 >[(comp `(c0[|`s]c1))]hs4)]hs3)))))))
  ralrimivvva(hs0, hs1, hs4, (c1 ‚ãÇ Cat), (c1 ‚ãÇ Cat), (c1 ‚ãÇ Cat), w0, ‚àÄ(hs3 ‚àà(hs0[(Hom ` c2)]hs1), ‚àÄ(hs2 ‚àà(hs1[(Hom ` c2)]hs4),(hs2[(< hs0, hs1 >[(comp ` c2)]hs4)]hs3)=(hs2[(< hs0, hs1 >[(comp `(c0[|`s]c1))]hs4)]hs3))))
  ralrimivva(hs3, hs2, (hs0[(Hom ` c2)]hs1), (hs1[(Hom ` c2)]hs4), (w0 ‚àß(hs0 ‚àà(c1 ‚ãÇ Cat)‚àß hs1 ‚àà(c1 ‚ãÇ Cat)‚àß hs4 ‚àà(c1 ‚ãÇ Cat))), (hs2[(< hs0, hs1 >[(comp ` c2)]hs4)]hs3)=(hs2[(< hs0, hs1 >[(comp `(c0[|`s]c1))]hs4)]hs3))

  catcco(hs2, hs0, hs1, (comp ` c2), hs4, hs3, c2, c1, (Base ` c2), universe, ((w0 ‚àß(hs0 ‚àà(c1 ‚ãÇ Cat)‚àß hs1 ‚àà(c1 ‚ãÇ Cat)‚àß hs4 ‚àà(c1 ‚ãÇ Cat)))‚àß(hs3 ‚àà(hs0[(Hom ` c2)]hs1)‚àß hs2 ‚àà(hs1[(Hom ` c2)]hs4))))

blocks.name: catciso
blocks.content: A functor is an isomorphism of categories if and only if it is full and faithful, and is a bijection on the objects. Remark 3.28(2) in [Adamek] p. 34. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Jan-2017.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: catcfuccl
blocks.content: The category of categories for a weak universe is closed under the functor category operation. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Jan-2017.)
